metadata.Title: CVE-2022-29917 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers Andrew McCreight, Gabriele Svelto, Tom Ritter and the Mozilla Fuzzing Team reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 99 and Firefox ESR 91.8. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.9, Firefox ESR < 91.9, and Firefox < 100.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29917` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 100.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 100.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 100.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '100.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
